results.title: Burden of dreams
results.brief_description: A documentary by Les Blank which provides a detailed look at the making of the ill-starred five year production of Werner Herzog’s feature film ‘Fitzcarraldo’. Set in the jungle of Peru ‘Fitzcarraldo’ is the story of an opera mad genius (played by Klaus Kinski) who will stop at nothing to achieve his ideal of building an opera house in the middle of the jungle. In many ways the narrative of Fitzcarraldo parallels Herzog’s production experiences. Despite one setback after another in filming: from monsoonal floods to warring native tribespeople, Herzog persisted with his dream until the film was complete. Not a conventional ‘behind-the-scenes’ promotional documentary, but a film which raises the question about the pursuit of art and what it can entail.

results.title: Call of the wild
results.creator_credit: Ken Annakin, Arthur Brauner, Harry Allen Towers, Towers of London (Films), Universal Pictures France, Oceania Produzioni Internazionali Cinematografiche, Izaro Films, CCC Filmkunst and Massfilms
results.brief_description: One of a plethora of adaptations for the big and small screen of Jack London’s famous novel, this 1972 film version of “Call of the wild” features Charlton Heston as Jack Thornton, a kindly would-be prospector heading for the 1897 Klondike gold rush, who adopts a mistreated dog. The man and the animal strike up a unique friendship as they travel through the wilderness. This family orientated film was a multi-national production filmed on location in Norway. The voices of non-English speaking actors were dubbed into English. Cast also includes Michele Mercier, George Eastman and Maria Rohm.

results.title: Call of the wild
results.creator_credit: Peter Svatek, Julie Allan, Pieter Kroonenburg, Kingsborough Greenlight Pictures, Fries/Schultz Film Group and Hallmark Entertainment
results.brief_description: Based on Jack London’s classic novel about an Alaskan gold prospector and the dog he saves from a brutal life of slavery as a sled dog in Canada’s vast frozen Yukon territory. This French/Canadian co-production has been hailed as one of the most accurate dramatic presentations of London’s work. Cast includes Rutger Hauer, Burke Lawrence, Charles Powell, Bronwen Booth and Richard Dreyfuss

results.title: Call it murder = Midnight
results.brief_description: A decision (and ensuing conviction that all murderers are subject to capital punishment) to sentence a woman to death for a crime of passion comes back to haunt jury foreman Edward Weldon (O.P. Heggie), when he has a personal stake in a capital punishment trial. Weldon’s daughter, Stella (Sidney Fox) kills a former lover who betrayed her, challenging her father’s assumption that all murderers deserve the ultimate punishment, and all on the eve of the execution of the woman he helped sway the jury to send to the electric chair. Humphrey Bogart plays a brief but memorable role as one of the murder victims. Cast also includes Granville Bates and Helen Flint.

results.title: California suite
results.creator_credit: Herbert Ross, Ray Stark and Columbia Films
results.brief_description: Five couples find themselves in a Beverley Hills hotel during the week of the Oscars. Four stories blend with an all star cast and the slick writing style of Neil Simon, to produce a comedy about human behaviour in all its variety. Maggie Smith won the Oscar for this 1970’s comedy which made the transition from the New York Stage to the big screen. Also stars: Jane Fonda, Alan Alda, Michael Caine, Walter Matthau, Elaine May, Herb Edelman, Denise Galik, Richard Pryor, Bill Cosby, Gloria Gifford and Sheila Frazier.

results.title: Call It Murder
results.brief_description: A jury foreman is persecuted by the press, and even his family, after sending a woman to the electric chair. Stars Humphrey Bogart. Originally released as “Midnight”. Rated: PG

results.title: Calamity Jane
results.creator_credit: David Butler, William Jacobs and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: This musical western has Doris Day as Calamity Jane and Howard Keel as Wild Bill Hickcock. Calamity Jane comes in from the ‘Windy city’ after finding a star attraction for the local saloon. As she is taken by the ‘Deadwood Stage’ to the ‘Black hills of Dakota’, she meets Wild Bill Hickock, her ‘Secret love’. This is the Wild West in a spectacular musical.

results.title: Cal
results.creator_credit: Pat O'Connor, David Puttnam, Stuart Craig and Enigma Productions
results.brief_description: Cal, played by John Lynch in a very impressive film debut, is an unemployed 19 year-old Catholic who is unwillingly drawn into the dangerous and violent world of the IRA, becoming an accomplice in the murder of a Protestant policeman. When he gets a job on the lonely farm where the dead man’s widow Marcella, played flawlessly by Helen Mirren, lives with her in-laws, Cal finds himself drawn to her. It is the start of a passionate affair between the guilt-ridden youth and the unhappy woman, a moving romance that ultimately ends in tragedy. This compelling story gains considerably in its dramatic impact from the superbly realized background of the bitter sectarian violence in Northern Ireland. Based on the original novel by Bernard MacLaverty and featuring the beautifully haunting music of Mark Knopfler (Dire Straits).
